DOC.brief_title: Comparative Bioavailability Two Forms Vitamin C
DOC.criteria: Healthy determine laboratory result medical history Females child bear potential BMI 1830 kg/m2 Agrees consume low vitamin C diet Nonsmoker exsmoker > 1 year Pregnant , breastfeeding , plan become pregnant trial Alcohol > 2 drink per day ; alcohol drug abuse within past year Cardiac condition Duodenal ulcer gastric ulcer , gastritis , hiatus hernia , gastroesophageal reflux disease ( GERD ) within past 3 month History irritable bowel syndrome , malabsorption significant GI disease History kidney stone Use medication know interact vitamin C Use supplement contain vitamin C Use anticoagulant ( warfarin ) , barbiturates , tetracycline antibiotic , betablockers , cyclosporine , prednisone , tricyclic antidepressant , diuretic nitrate medication History current diagnosis cancer Uncontrolled hypertension History diabetes , renal disease and/or liver disease Unstable psychiatric disorder History current immunocompromise History hemochromatosis hemoglobinopathy Participation clinical research trial < 30 day Use acute medication w/in 72 hour intervention Unstable medication < 90 day Abnormal liver function Serum creatinine > 1.5 x upper limit normal ( ULN ) Anemia etiology Blood donation w/in last 2 month Allergy sensitivity test article , food beverage provide study Cognitive impairment and/or unable give inform consent
